questions.question: A container has 160 liters of pure milk. If 20 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated three times, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 140L, Water = 20L. After second replacement: Milk = 140 - (20 × 140/160) = 140 - 17.5 = 122.5L, Water = 37.5L. After third replacement: Milk = 122.5 - (20 × 122.5/160) = 122.5 - 15.31 = 107.19L, Water = 52.81L. After fourth replacement: Milk = 107.19 - (20 × 107.19/160) = 107.19 - 13.4 = 93.79L, Water = 66.21L. Ratio = 93.79:66.21 ≈ 81:79.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of pulses costing Rs. 30/kg, Rs. 45/kg, and Rs. 60/kg in the ratio 3:2:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 55/kg, what is his profit percentage?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 7:3. If 25 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 12 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 10x liters (7x milk + 3x water). After replacement: Milk = 7x - (25 × 7x/10x) = 7x - 17.5, Water = 3x - (25 × 3x/10x) + 25 = 3x - 7.5 + 25 = 3x + 17.5. After adding milk: Milk = 7x - 17.5 + 12 = 7x - 5.5, Water = 3x + 17.5. New ratio = (7x-5.5):(3x+17.5) = 5:4. Solving, 28x-22 = 15x+87.5, 13x = 109.5, x ≈ 8.42. Final ratio ≈ 53.44:42.76 ≈ 5:4.

questions.question: A container has 200 liters of pure milk. If 40 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated twice more, what percentage of milk remains in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 160L, Water = 40L. After second replacement: Milk = 160 - (40 × 160/200) = 160 - 32 = 128L, Water = 72L. After third replacement: Milk = 128 - (40 × 128/200) = 128 - 25.6 = 102.4L, Water = 97.6L. Percentage of milk = (102.4/200) × 100 = 51.2%.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes two types of wheat costing Rs. 80/kg and Rs. 120/kg in such a way that he gains 33.33% by selling the mixture at Rs. 140/kg. Find the ratio in which the wheats are mixed.
questions.explanation: Let the ratio be x:y. Cost price of mixture = 140/1.3333 = Rs. 105/kg. Using alligation: (120-105):(105-80) = x:y. Therefore, 15:25 = x:y, which means x:y = 1:2.

questions.question: A mixture of 90 liters contains milk and water in the ratio 8:1. If 18 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 9 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Initial milk = 80L, water = 10L. After replacement: Milk = 80 - (18 × 80/90) = 80 - 16 = 64L, Water = 10 - (18 × 10/90) + 18 = 10 - 2 + 18 = 26L. After adding milk: Milk = 64 + 9 = 73L, Water = 26L. Ratio = 73:26 ≈ 7:5.

questions.question: A container has 240 liters of pure milk. If 48 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated twice more, what percentage of water is in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 192L, Water = 48L. After second replacement: Milk = 192 - (48 × 192/240) = 192 - 38.4 = 153.6L, Water = 86.4L. After third replacement: Milk = 153.6 - (48 × 153.6/240) = 153.6 - 30.72 = 122.88L, Water = 117.12L. Percentage of water = (117.12/240) × 100 = 54.4%.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of spices costing Rs. 50/kg, Rs. 75/kg, and Rs. 100/kg in the ratio 4:3:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 90/kg, what is his profit percentage?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 9:2. If 22 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 11 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 11x liters (9x milk + 2x water). After replacement: Milk = 9x - (22 × 9x/11x) = 9x - 18, Water = 2x - (22 × 2x/11x) + 22 = 2x - 4 + 22 = 2x + 18. After adding milk: Milk = 9x - 18 + 11 = 9x - 7, Water = 2x + 18. New ratio = (9x-7):(2x+18) = 6:5. Solving, 45x-35 = 12x+108, 33x = 143, x ≈ 4.33. Final ratio ≈ 32:29.66 ≈ 6:5.

questions.question: A container has 280 liters of pure milk. If 56 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated once more, what is the ratio of milk to water in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 224L, Water = 56L. After second replacement: Milk = 224 - (56 × 224/280) = 224 - 44.8 = 179.2L, Water = 100.8L. Ratio = 179.2:100.8 = 4:3.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 11:3. If 28 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 14 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 14x liters (11x milk + 3x water). After replacement: Milk = 11x - (28 × 11x/14x) = 11x - 22, Water = 3x - (28 × 3x/14x) + 28 = 3x - 6 + 28 = 3x + 22. After adding milk: Milk = 11x - 22 + 14 = 11x - 8, Water = 3x + 22. New ratio = (11x-8):(3x+22) = 8:5. Solving, 55x-40 = 24x+176, 31x = 216, x ≈ 6.97. Final ratio ≈ 68.67:42.91 ≈ 8:5.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of nuts costing Rs. 70/kg, Rs. 105/kg, and Rs. 140/kg in the ratio 3:2:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 130/kg, what is his profit percentage?
A container has 320 liters of pure milk. If 64 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated twice more, what percentage of water is in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 256L, Water = 64L. After second replacement: Milk = 256 - (64 × 256/320) = 256 - 51.2 = 204.8L, Water = 115.2L. After third replacement: Milk = 204.8 - (64 × 204.8/320) = 204.8 - 40.96 = 163.84L, Water = 156.16L. Percentage of water = (156.16/320) × 100 = 57.8%.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 13:4. If 34 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 17 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 17x liters (13x milk + 4x water). After replacement: Milk = 13x - (34 × 13x/17x) = 13x - 26, Water = 4x - (34 × 4x/17x) + 34 = 4x - 8 + 34 = 4x + 26. After adding milk: Milk = 13x - 26 + 17 = 13x - 9, Water = 4x + 26. New ratio = (13x-9):(4x+26) = 9:7. Solving, 91x-63 = 36x+234, 55x = 297, x ≈ 5.4. Final ratio ≈ 61.2:47.6 ≈ 9:7.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes two types of coffee costing Rs. 90/kg and Rs. 135/kg in such a way that he gains 35% by selling the mixture at Rs. 160/kg. Find the ratio in which the coffees are mixed.
questions.explanation: Let the ratio be x:y. Cost price of mixture = 160/1.35 = Rs. 118.52/kg. Using alligation: (135-118.52):(118.52-90) = x:y. Therefore, 16.48:28.52 = x:y, which means x:y = 1:2.

questions.question: A container has 400 liters of pure milk. If 80 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated once more, what is the ratio of milk to water in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 320L, Water = 80L. After second replacement: Milk = 320 - (80 × 320/400) = 320 - 64 = 256L, Water = 144L. Ratio = 256:144 = 4:3.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 14:5. If 38 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 19 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 19x liters (14x milk + 5x water). After replacement: Milk = 14x - (38 × 14x/19x) = 14x - 28, Water = 5x - (38 × 5x/19x) + 38 = 5x - 10 + 38 = 5x + 28. After adding milk: Milk = 14x - 28 + 19 = 14x - 9, Water = 5x + 28. New ratio = (14x-9):(5x+28) = 10:7. Solving, 98x-63 = 50x+280, 48x = 343, x ≈ 7.15. Final ratio ≈ 91.1:63.75 ≈ 10:7.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of dried fruits costing Rs. 60/kg, Rs. 90/kg, and Rs. 120/kg in the ratio 5:3:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 110/kg, what is his profit percentage?
A container has 440 liters of pure milk. If 88 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated twice more, what percentage of milk remains in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 352L, Water = 88L. After second replacement: Milk = 352 - (88 × 352/440) = 352 - 70.4 = 281.6L, Water = 158.4L. After third replacement: Milk = 281.6 - (88 × 281.6/440) = 281.6 - 56.32 = 225.28L, Water = 214.72L. Percentage of milk = (225.28/440) × 100 = 42.2%.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 15:6. If 42 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 21 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 21x liters (15x milk + 6x water). After replacement: Milk = 15x - (42 × 15x/21x) = 15x - 30, Water = 6x - (42 × 6x/21x) + 42 = 6x - 12 + 42 = 6x + 30. After adding milk: Milk = 15x - 30 + 21 = 15x - 9, Water = 6x + 30. New ratio = (15x-9):(6x+30) = 11:8. Solving, 120x-72 = 66x+330, 54x = 402, x ≈ 7.44. Final ratio ≈ 102.6:74.64 ≈ 11:8.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes two types of tea costing Rs. 110/kg and Rs. 165/kg in such a way that he gains 37.5% by selling the mixture at Rs. 180/kg. Find the ratio in which the teas are mixed.
questions.explanation: Let the ratio be x:y. Cost price of mixture = 180/1.375 = Rs. 130.91/kg. Using alligation: (165-130.91):(130.91-110) = x:y. Therefore, 34.09:20.91 = x:y, which means x:y = 1:2.

questions.question: A container has 480 liters of pure milk. If 96 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated once more, what is the ratio of milk to water in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 384L, Water = 96L. After second replacement: Milk = 384 - (96 × 384/480) = 384 - 76.8 = 307.2L, Water = 172.8L. Ratio = 307.2:172.8 = 4:3.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 16:7. If 46 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 23 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 23x liters (16x milk + 7x water). After replacement: Milk = 16x - (46 × 16x/23x) = 16x - 32, Water = 7x - (46 × 7x/23x) + 46 = 7x - 14 + 46 = 7x + 32. After adding milk: Milk = 16x - 32 + 23 = 16x - 9, Water = 7x + 32. New ratio = (16x-9):(7x+32) = 12:9. Solving, 144x-81 = 84x+384, 60x = 465, x ≈ 7.75. Final ratio ≈ 115:69.25 ≈ 12:9.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of chocolates costing Rs. 80/kg, Rs. 120/kg, and Rs. 160/kg in the ratio 6:4:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 150/kg, what is his profit percentage?
A container has 520 liters of pure milk. If 104 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated twice more, what percentage of water is in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 416L, Water = 104L. After second replacement: Milk = 416 - (104 × 416/520) = 416 - 83.2 = 332.8L, Water = 187.2L. After third replacement: Milk = 332.8 - (104 × 332.8/520) = 332.8 - 66.56 = 266.24L, Water = 253.76L. Percentage of water = (253.76/520) × 100 = 57.8%.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 17:8. If 50 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 25 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 25x liters (17x milk + 8x water). After replacement: Milk = 17x - (50 × 17x/25x) = 17x - 34, Water = 8x - (50 × 8x/25x) + 50 = 8x - 16 + 50 = 8x + 34. After adding milk: Milk = 17x - 34 + 25 = 17x - 9, Water = 8x + 34. New ratio = (17x-9):(8x+34) = 13:10. Solving, 170x-90 = 104x+442, 66x = 532, x ≈ 8.06. Final ratio ≈ 128.02:98.48 ≈ 13:10.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes two types of coffee costing Rs. 120/kg and Rs. 180/kg in such a way that he gains 42.86% by selling the mixture at Rs. 200/kg. Find the ratio in which the coffees are mixed.
questions.explanation: Let the ratio be x:y. Cost price of mixture = 200/1.4286 = Rs. 140/kg. Using alligation: (180-140):(140-120) = x:y. Therefore, 40:20 = x:y, which means x:y = 1:2.

questions.question: A container has 560 liters of pure milk. If 112 liters of milk is replaced with water and this process is repeated once more, what is the ratio of milk to water in the final mixture?
questions.explanation: After first replacement: Milk = 448L, Water = 112L. After second replacement: Milk = 448 - (112 × 448/560) = 448 - 89.6 = 358.4L, Water = 201.6L. Ratio = 358.4:201.6 = 4:3.

questions.question: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 18:9. If 54 liters of the mixture is replaced with water and then 27 liters of milk is added, what is the final ratio of milk to water?
questions.explanation: Let initial quantity be 27x liters (18x milk + 9x water). After replacement: Milk = 18x - (54 × 18x/27x) = 18x - 36, Water = 9x - (54 × 9x/27x) + 54 = 9x - 18 + 54 = 9x + 36. After adding milk: Milk = 18x - 36 + 27 = 18x - 9, Water = 9x + 36. New ratio = (18x-9):(9x+36) = 14:11. Solving, 198x-99 = 126x+504, 72x = 603, x ≈ 8.38. Final ratio ≈ 141.84:111.42 ≈ 14:11.

questions.question: A shopkeeper mixes three types of spices costing Rs. 90/kg, Rs. 135/kg, and Rs. 180/kg in the ratio 7:5:1. If he sells the mixture at Rs. 170/kg, what is his profit percentage?
